page.title: 03ECOLOGY PART 2/CHURCH
page.content: At the back of the Belltower there was a garden which had a lawn with gooseberry and blackcurrent bushes. You can tell it was a lawn because there are no trees there.The bushes no longer bear fruit as they are now wild. The main trees are evergreens and the main flowers are Campians, Bluebells and Foxgloves. {COLAN CHURCH}was build in l250 and is made of granite and slate with a tower and is very sturdy looking. By the church door there is a pillar of granite which was found by the OLD CORNWALL SOCIETY in a hedge and in l970 it was erected in the Church grounds and is known as the {COLAN {CROSS. Outside the door there are some {iron bars which are used for wiping {feet.The lamposts around the graveyard {look Victorian. {
